result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald S Horan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
While incarcerated 25% of the inmate funds shall be applied to outstanding financial obligations.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: AODA evaluation and comply as deemed necessary.

Counseling deemed necessary.

Absolute sobriety.   Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.

supervisions.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

1:49 Defendant Ronald S Horan in court with attorney Philip J. Brehm.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Andrew DeWitt is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a detective with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. He was one of the lead detectives of the homicide investigation. He was contacted by Officer LaBarre regarding a homicide investigation. Defendant had placed a call to 911 and wanted to report a murder. Exhibit #1 is marked and reviewed with witness.  Exhibit is received. He and Detective Reblin spoke with defendant at the police department. Video of interview is played and marked as Exhibit #2. Witness testifies as to his interview with defendant.
2:14 Attorney Brehm cross-examines witness.  
2:19 Attorney Lambert redirects.
2:21 Gary Kryshak is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Brehm. He is an attorney. He represented defendant at jury trial in September of 2016. Testifies what his trial strategy was. Attorney Brehm states that he is waiving his attorney client privilege. Defendant states this is true. Testifies as to defendant being on probation and then getting revoked from probation. Testifies as to why he advised the jury that he was in prison. Testifies as to why he did not file a suppression motion. He expected defendant to testify.
2:35 Attorney Lambert cross-examines witness.  
2:42 Attorney Brehm redirects. 
2:44 Court in recess.
3:04 Court reconvenes. Attorney Brehm makes statement regarding ineffective assistance of counsel and absence of withdraw his motion regarding not filing suppression motion. Court questions defendant regarding Attorney Brehm's withdrawal of motion. He agrees to withdraw motion.
Attorney Lambert makes statement.
Attorney Brehm makes additional statement.
Court denies motion for new trial due to ineffective counsel.
ad Testificandum

records.addlTxt:
11:02 Defendant Ronald S Horan in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Lambert makes statement and recommends 17 years 6 months WSP, 7 years, 6 months ITC and 10 years ES. Sentence consecutive to present sentence.
Attorney Kryshak makes statement and recommends 7 years WSP, 3 years ITC and 4 years ES concurrent to present sentence.
Court sentences defendant to 15 years WSP, 7 years ITC and 8 years ES consecutive to any other sentence.
Ad Prosequendum
Sentencing hearing on December 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ronald S Horan
Current: 1730 West Snell Road, c/o Oshkosh Correctional Institute, Oshkosh, WI 54903 United States  (Effective: 09-15-2016)
Prior: C/o Wood County Jail, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494
Alternate Juror
List of Jurors
Jury Trial Witness Fees - $19.20 (GK)

8:55 Defendant Ronald S Horan in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court convenes without presence of jury. Court puts jury instruction conference on record. 
9:06 Jurors are brought into courtroom. Court gives jury instructions. 
9:19 Attorney Lambert gives closing statement.
9:35 Attorney Kryshak gives closing statement.
9:46 Attorney Lambert gives closing rebuttal statement.
9:51 Court gives closing jury instructions. Juror #1166 is selected as alternate and is excused. 
9:58 Court officers are sworn and jurors retire to deliberate. Audio recordings played during State's closing argument is marked as exhibit #11 and is received. Attorney Lambert feels exhibits should be given to jury only if they request them. Attorney Kryshak wants them all to go back except for the recordings. Exhibits 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9 & 10 will be given to the jury.
10:04 Court in recess.
12:27 Jurors return with verdict of guilty. Court polls jury as a group and they state this is their verdict. Jury is dismissed.
Attorney Lambert moves for entry of conviction. Court enters conviction. Court orders Pre-Sentence Investigation. Bond is revoked. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary

9:07 Defendant Ronald S Horan in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court convenes without presence of jury. Attorney Lambert is requesting additional jury instruction. Attorney Kryshak is not objecting.
Attorney Kryshak has also is requesting additional jury instruction. It will be discussed further at jury instruction conference. Attorney Lambert is objecting and since it will be read in preliminary jury instructions, he requests that it be discussed now. It will be argued now. Motion to modify instruction is denied. Attorney Kryshak wishes to make it a continuing objection.
Attorney Lambert states parties stipulate regarding chain of custody of the body. Coroner does not need to testify and jury would be told the facts of his findings. Death certificate will be marked as exhibit. Parties agree that first and middle names are transposed on death certificate. Parties agree no foundation has to be layed for photographs to be introduced. No experts will be called regarding blood tests of defendant and victim. 911 call will be admitted into evidence and played for the jury. Parties agree that evidence about defendant burying victim in back yard is not other acts evidence. Defendant lived at residence since 2008. Attorney Kryshak and defendant agree to all stipulations. Parties agree that everything that needs to be redacted on report has been. They were blacked out. Parties agree that defendant has 10 prior criminal convictions. One alternate will be selected. Each party will get five strikes.
9:31 Jurors are brought into courtroom and are sworn. Twenty three jurors are called to the box.
9:39 Court begins voir dire.
9:50 Attorney Lambert does voir dire. Juror #1184 struck for cause. Juror #1192 struck for cause. 
10:24 Attorney Kryshak does voir dire. 
10:27 Strikes are made. Court reads preliminary jury instructions.
10:39 Thirteen jurors are sworn.
10:43 Attorney Lambert makes opening statement. 
10:51 Attorney Kryshak makes opening statement. 
11:00 Jurors in recess. Court advises parties that media will be allowed in the courtroom.
11:01 Court in recess.
11:21 Court reconvenes. Ross Radtke is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a patrol officer with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. On 8/7/14, he was dispatched to a residence on Baker Street in the City of Wisconsin Rapids, Wood County. A caller was reporting a murder. 911 recording is played for the jury. Recording is marked as Exhibit #1. Witness states that when he arrived he noticed blood on the stairs and a baseball cap. He made contact with defendant. The defendant had blood on his arm. Defendant told him that he killed his brother and he buried him in the yard. He found the body in the back yard under dirt and leaves and identified him as T.H. He knows him from past contacts. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. 
11:30 Attorney Kryshak cross-examines witness. 
11:33 Attorney Lambert redirects. 
11:34 Attorney Kryshak cross-examines witness. 
11:35 Jordan Lubeck is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a patrol officer with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. On 8/7/14, he assisted at the scene. Defendant told him that he killed his brother and buried him in the back yard.
11:37 Attorney Kryshak crosse-examines witness. 
11:38 Eric Daven is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a patrol officer at the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. On 8/7/14, he assisted at the scene. He states he located the body in the back yard. When he located the body he started CPR until ambulance arrived.
11:41 Attorney Kryshak cross-examines witness. 
11:43 Attorney Lambert announces to jury that Gary Kronstedt will not be testifying as parties stipulate that he pronounced T.H. dead and filed death certificate. Death certificate is marked as Exhibit #2. Attorney Lambert notes that first and middle names are transposed. 
11:47 Jurors in recess. Attorney Lambert states that there are 3 recordings on exhibit #1, but only the 911 call was played.
11:48 Court in recess for lunch.
1:07 Court convenes without presence of jury. Attorney Lambert states that the report that was redacted has been changed from blackout to whiteout.
1:09 Jury is brought into courtroom. Andrew DeWitt is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a detective with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. Testifies as to his employment. He states that defendant has lived at residence on Baker Street from 2008 until 8/7/14. Exhibits #3-5 are marked and reviewed with witness. Exhibits are received and shown to the jury. Audio recording of interview with defendant is played for the jury.
2:29 Court in recess. 
2:50 Court reconvenes. Audio recording of interview with defendant is marked as exhibit #6 and received. Attorney Lambert continues questioning witness Andrew Dewitt. He states that victim's body was transported to Madison for an autopsy. 
2:56 Attorney Kryshak cross-examines witness. Exhibits #7 & 8 are reviewed with witness. Exhibits are received and shown to the jury. Exhibit #9 is marked and reviewed with witness. Exhibit is received. 
3:13 Attorney Lambert redirects. Testifies as to what defendant told him about victim falling down the stairs. 
3:15 Attorney Kryshak cross-examines witness. 
3:16 Attorney Lambert redirects.
3:17 Attorney Kryshak cross-examines witness. 
3:18 Eric Daven is recalled as a witness. Exhibit #4 is reviewed with witness. 
3:20 Attorney Kryshak cross-examines witness. 
3:21 Dr. Vincent Tranchida is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a forensic pathologist. Testifies as to his education and background. Testifies as to how an autopsy is performed. Testifies as to performing autopsy on victim, T.H. Exhibit #10 is marked and reviewed with witness. Exhibit is received. He states that the victim died from blunt force tramua to his neck. 
3:31 Attorney Kryshak cross-examines witness. Testifies as to blood alcohol content of victim. 
3:37 State rests. Jury in recess.  Attorney Kryshak makes a motion to dismiss. Attorney Lambert makes statement. Court denies motion. Court questions defendant regarding his decision to testify and his rights. He says he wishes to testify and it is his decision. Court finds that the defendant's decision to testify is freely and voluntary.
3:48 Jury is brought back into courtroom. Ron Horan is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Kryshak. He states he has been convicted of a crime 10 times. He is currently residing in prison in Oshkosh. Testifies as to his relationship with his brother, T.H. He testifies as to drinking with his brother on 8/7/14. Later in the evening, they got into an argument about his brother's girlfiend. T.H. threatened to tell his probation agent that he was drinking. He was not allowed to drink on probation. States that T.H. went out the door and he slammed the door. He heard some thumps and thought T.H. had fallen down the stairs. He looked down the stairs and told him to get up. He noticed he had blood coming from his head. He listened for a heartbeat and breaths. He tired to do CPR. He went back to his apartment to think and then buried T.H. in the back yard. He called 911 after a couple hours. He says he did not intend to hurt T.H. 
4:05 Attorney Lambert cross-examines witness. 
4:15 Attorney Kryshak redirects. 
4:17 Defense rests. Jury in recess until 9:00 tomorrow. Attorney Kryshak renews his motion to dismiss. Attorney Lambert puts previous sidebar on record. Court puts ruling on record. Court again denies motion to dismiss.
4:24 Court in recess.

8:21 Defendant Ronald S Horan in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant Ronald S Horan in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Lambert has made a motion to use recorded segments of defendant's statement at trial. Attorney Kryshak also has segments that he wishes to play. He is objecting to the segments that Attorney Kryshak wishes to play. Attorney Kryshak makes statement and feels the audio should be played in full.  Attorney Lambert states he agrees that entire tape be played.
Court questions defendant and he agrees. Court approves that entire recording be played. Attorney Lambert states that he also wishes to play 911 call and audo from when defendant was in booking room but not being questioned by officers. Attorney Kryshak has no objection. Granted.

Court reconvenes at later time without presence of defendant.
Attorney Lambert states that Attorney Kryshak wishes to have a copy of the death certificate and wants Court to order that he be given a copy. Court so orders.
Defendant's Brief in Support of the Requested Jury Instruction on the Burden of Proof
Cover Letter from Atty. Gary J. Kryshak, dated Sept. 8, 2016.
Ad Prosequendum
Jury trial - 12 person at 09-14-2016 09:00 am
Jury trial - 12 person at 09-14-2016 09:00 am
Jury Instruction Checklist
Ad Prosequendum

11:35 Defendant Ronald S Horan in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant Ronald S Horan in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Vincent Trachita appears by phone and is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He states that he is a forensic pathologist in Dane County, Wisconsin. Testifies as to what his role is in doing an autopsy. Testifies as to calling the death a homicide. Attorney Kryshak cross-examines witness. Attorney Lambert redirects. 
Defendant's prior convictions are discussed. Court will allow all 10 convictions. 
Court denies defense motion regarding using word homicide in autopsy report. Court orders that word be blacked out on report.

(Defendant)
from Atty. Gary J. Kryshak, dated November 17, 2014, re Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
Scheduling conference on January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Ronald S Horan in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant Ronald S Horan in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Craig Lambert appears for the State. Attorney Gary Kryshak appears for defendant. Defendant appears in person, in custody.  Detective Andy Dewitt is sworn and questioned by Attorney Lambert. Testifies to speaking with the officers who arrived on the scene at the defendant's home.  Testifies to speaking with the defendant who told him the specifics of the incident.  Testifies that the victim passed away from neck injuries as a result of a fall.  Parties stipulate to identification of the defendant. Cross-examination by Attorney Kryshak.  Re-direct by Attorney Lambert.

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed it. Bond is continued.

Defendant Ronald S Horan in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant Ronald S Horan in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kryshak makes a statement that the Complaint does not have sufficient facts to proceed and requests that the matter be dismissed.  Attorney Lambert makes a statement opposing Attorney Kryshak's motion.    

Court denies the motion to dismiss.  Arraignment scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on November 12, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

9:08 Defendant Ronald S Horan in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant Ronald S Horan in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Transferred to Branch 1 for preliminary hearing. Waives time limits.
